intro: Actinoschoenus glabrispiculus, commonly known as the smooth-spined spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its drought tolerance, it is well adapted to survive in regions with limited water availability.
